pull.title: Tests: Fill out dust limit unit test for known types except bare multisig
pull.body:
Having the constants checked explicitly in a single spot helps with possible regressions and also useful for documentation.

In addition, add a check for undefined v1 witness programs.

events.message: Fill out dust limit unit test for known types except bare multisig

events.body:
Code-review ACK b093f5619f8f9b7d63ee60ff04de00b907b13d64

Cross-checked the dust limit values by comparing to the output of the functional dust limit test that #26631 introduces:
```
2023-01-13T14:57:38.059000Z TestFramework (INFO): Test default dust limit setting (3000 sat/kvB)...
2023-01-13T14:57:38.064000Z TestFramework (INFO): -> Test P2PK (uncompressed) output (size 67, limit 672)
2023-01-13T14:57:38.100000Z TestFramework (INFO): -> Test P2PK (compressed) output (size 35, limit 576)
2023-01-13T14:57:38.119000Z TestFramework (INFO): -> Test P2PKH output (size 25, limit 546)
2023-01-13T14:57:38.133000Z TestFramework (INFO): -> Test P2SH output (size 23, limit 540)
2023-01-13T14:57:38.146000Z TestFramework (INFO): -> Test P2WPKH output (size 22, limit 294)
2023-01-13T14:57:38.159000Z TestFramework (INFO): -> Test P2WSH output (size 34, limit 330)
2023-01-13T14:57:38.173000Z TestFramework (INFO): -> Test P2TR output (size 34, limit 330)
2023-01-13T14:57:38.187000Z TestFramework (INFO): -> Test P2?? (future witness version 2) output (size 4, limit 240)
2023-01-13T14:57:38.201000Z TestFramework (INFO): -> Test P2?? (future witness version 16) output (size 42, limit 354)
2023-01-13T14:57:38.215000Z TestFramework (INFO): -> Test bare multisig (m-of-3) output (size 201, limit 1074)
2023-01-13T14:57:38.231000Z TestFramework (INFO): -> Test null data (OP_RETURN) output (size 20, limit 0)
```


(somehow unrelated side-note: through the comment for uncompressed P2PK, TIL about the existence of "hybrid" pubkeys, prefixed with 0x06 or 0x07 instead of 0x04 ðŸ‘€ : https://bitcoin.stackexchange.com/questions/57855/c-secp256k1-what-do-prefixes-0x06-and-0x07-in-an-uncompressed-public-key-signif)

OpenSSL is a trip :)

I didn't know about that PR, sorry! Will take a look there as well.
